issue.title: macOS Monterey deleting bitcoin core after updates (M1)
issue.body:
When updating to macOS Monterey the bitcoin core app is deleted from the applications folder. If pinned to the dock you will see a "?" where it was in it's location.

Did not delete wallet or node data. Reinstalling the application works just fine.

events.body:
Did it happen to Bitcoin Core app only?
Is it a macOS Monterey expected or buggy behavior?

Yes only to Bitcoin Core app while third party applications that have also been downloaded from an external source remain. This wasn't expected in prior builds but it has happened twice thus far on Beta 7 and 6 of macOS Monterey.

Update: Beta 8 does the same. Looking at logs for any reference to the deletion but my assumption it's been added to xprotect and treating it as malware.

@nunya-mich 

Is it a self-compiled binary, or a signed release binary?
Self-compiled is good to go it appears to be the signed release binary only at this time. The self-compiled survive the last beta update.

I have it too. This problem/bug has existed for more than a year. Such problem exists on Bigsur & Monterey. I just installed bitcoin core and after three days - no more program files on the computer. Just these files:

I was able to reproduce this behaviour in a virtual machine. 

After updating from macOS 12.2 to 12.2.1 the Bitcoin Core application `/Applications/Bitcoin-Qt.app/` was gone. Fortunately the data directory is still available.

issue.title: Update signapple for platform identifier fix
issue.body:
Apparently #23134 is caused by the platform identifier field being set to the incorrect value in our code signatures. The problem has been resolved in signapple, and so guix should point to the latest commit containing the fix.

I suppose guix does not strictly need to have this; only the macOS code signer will need to have the fix.

Fixes #23134

issue.title: v23.0 testing
issue.body:
Umbrella issue for 23.0 testing. Please help testing on a wide variety of supported platforms, as well as interaction with different software.

Let us know which version you tested on which operating system.

If you find an issue, please search Github for known issues first and then open a new Github issue. This meta issue should not be used to report bugs, as a single thread makes it impossible to track more than one topic.

## What to test

For an idea what to test, see @stickies-v's [23.0 release candidate testing guide](https://github.com/bitcoin-core/bitcoin-devwiki/wiki/23.0-Release-Candidate-Testing-Guide), or

- See [Draft Release Notes](https://github.com/bitcoin-core/bitcoin-devwiki/wiki/23.0-Release-Notes-draft) for a list of changes-
- Also see testing reports for earlier releases ([v0.21.0](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/issues/20555) [v22.0](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/issues/22634))

## Known issues (as of rc5)

Other known issues:
- MacOS: SHA256 acceleration is not enabled on MacOS 11.x due to missing reporting of sysctl `hw.optional.arm.*`. Please upgrade to MacOS 12.x if this is important to you.

## Known issues fixed (as of rc5)

- [x] ~~Due to a naming conflict after adding support for the new MacOS architecture, we had to rename the following dmgs manually from `bitcoin-23.0rc2-osx-signed.dmg` during upload:~~
```
bitcoin-23.0rc2-arm64-apple-darwin.dmg
bitcoin-23.0rc2-x86_64-apple-darwin.dmg
```
~~This may cause issues during verification because in the `SHA256SUMS.asc` they still have the old name.~~
- [x] ~~MacOS: please postpone the Monterey 12.3.1 update until 23.0rc4 to test whether #23134 has been really fixed~~ (it's really fixed, see https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/issues/24501#issuecomment-1086857682)
- [x] ~~#24726 bitcoind/-qt may silently fail on Windows when using AVX2 SHA256 implementation~~
- [x] ~bitcoin-core/gui#571~~
- [x] ~~Windows GUI crashes while rendering bandwidth graph: bitcoin-core/gui#582~~

issue.title: Mac OS keeps deleting Bitcoin Core GUI
issue.body:
<!-- Describe the issue -->
I would expect the Bitcoin-QT client to stay on my machine, not to have to reinstall it every time.

<!--- What behavior did you expect? -->

It "disappears" - probably Mac OS' XProtect finds something it doesn't like in it and silently removes it

<!--- What was the actual behavior (provide screenshots if the issue is GUI-related)? -->

To reproduce: Have Bitcoin Core copied into the /Applications and wait some days

<!--- How reliably can you reproduce the issue, what are the steps to do so? -->

0.21.x, downloaded from Bitcoin.org

Mac OS 12.2, Macbook pro 16, 2019 model 

It doesn't keep log files anymore unless you have it set on the console app. I am not sure when it does this virus check.

events.body:
@procion1302 
> Could confirm this bug exist

What Bitcoin Core version?

If not v23.0, please try it.
